courses.course_name: Intensive Basic Concepts in Paralegal Studies
courses.description:
PARAL-DC 3000 Intensive Basic Concepts in Paralegal Studies 
This course provides a broad background in basic concepts: legal research; civil practice; torts; matrimonial (family law); criminal law; contracts; ethics; debtor-creditor relations; business organizations; trusts and estates; and real property.  The objective of this course is to acquaint the beginning student with the principles of jurisprudence and the vocabulary of the law.

PARAL-DC 3001 Basic Concepts in Paralegal Studies

The objective of this course is to acquaint the beginning student with the principles of jurisprudence and the vocabulary of the law.

courses.description:
PARAL-DC 3010 Intensive Advanced Concepts 
This course offers practical training in skills including: the formation, operation, sale, and dissolution of businesses; going public; leveraged buyouts; securities; U.C.C.; intellectual property; trusts and estates; litigation; and real estate.

PARAL-DC 3011 Advanced Concepts 
This course offers practical training in skills including: the formation, operation, sale, and dissolution of businesses; going public; leveraged buyouts; securities; U.C.C.; intellectual property; trusts and estates; litigation; and real estate.
